page.title: 09Botany
page.content: On our initial surveying we noticed a number of different varieties of wild flowers.This led to an interest among the group,and an urge to discover what the species were.Also,with our area being predominantly rural,we felt that a survey of the profusion of wild flowers along hedgerows to be of interest.We had noted the areas where we saw most flowers and it was decided to return and survey these areas fully. The survey was carried out on the 4 June which was quite a pleasant warm evening.We worked from 4.30 until about 7 p.m. We began by selecting 100 metre section in square 21,13.We worked at 10 metre intervals,and this first area was along the side of the road.We found the identification quite difficult because some flowers were dying,some were not in bud and some
